Author: N/A

Title: Asean News Headlines at 10pm on Tuesday (March 1, 2022)
Summary: Here's a look at the news highlights from Asean countries in the Star-AseanPlus section for Tuesday (March 1,2022)
Author: S. Navalan

Title: Najib's malicious prosecution lawsuit should be struck out, says DPP

Title: Mother of late Jamaludin Jarjis succeeds in appeal to set aside conditional stay
Summary: PUTRAJAYA: The mother of former minister, the late Tan Sri Jamaludin Mohd Jarjis, on Tuesday (March 1) succeeded in her appeal to set aside a conditional stay obtained by her two grandchildren, which among others barred her from disclosing information on Rantai Wawasan Sdn Bhd accounts to third parties.
Author: N/A

Summary: WHILE Malaysia grapples with growing numbers of Covid-19 cases, the underlying toll of the pandemic has hit communities hard as people struggle with job insecurity, loneliness and mental health concerns. The impact of the pandemic on women appears to be particularly harmful, as suggested by the increase of suicide rates among females.

Author: Nurzali Ismail

Title: Covid-19 Chronicles #9: Fighting to breathe
Summary: My memories of studying medicine in Russia include heavy grey winter skies, warm pirozhki in the freezing cold, and the choking odour of formalin-bathed cadavers in anatomy practicals. I remember vividly one cadaver we studied belonged to a lady.
Author: Dr Khayriyyah Mohd Hanafiah

Title: No let-up in global rainforest loss as coronavirus brings new danger
Summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Tropical rainforests disappeared at a rate of one football pitch every six seconds last year, researchers said on Tuesday, urging countries to include forest protection in post-pandemic plans
Author: N/A

Title: On our way to building smart residentials
Summary: ON July 1,2016, Bangladesh was thrown into a state of lockdown following a terrorist attack at the Holey Artisan restaurant in Dhaka. On April 21,2019, on Easter Sunday, Colombo city was rocked by bomb attacks in three prominent hotels and three churches, which led to a national emergency lockdown.
Author: Darryll Sinnappa

Title: Vital to beef up our cybersecurity, says Lee
Summary: PETALING JAYA: Cybercrime has emer­ged as a major security threat in our country, says Malay­sian Crime Prevention Founda­tion ­senior vice-chairman Tan Sri Lee Lam Thye.
Author: Clarissa Chung, Huei Teng

Title: Asia sees unexpected gains following virus lockdowns
Summary: PATHUM THANI, Thailand (AFP): As Asia starts to assess the damage caused by the pandemic, some countries are realising there have been unforeseen benefits.
Author: N/A

Title: Power of the Attorney General
Summary: Letter from WALTER SANDOSAM, former member of independent oversight panel, Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission
Author: N/A

Title: Police do poli-sing instead
Summary: PETALING JAYA: A police music video rendition of Ramadan Datang by Indonesian singer Tompi has been well received by the public since it was uploaded on the RMP (Royal Malaysia Police) TV channel over YouTube on April 23.
Author: Justin Zack

Title: Aliff to work on improving ties with his family
Summary: COSMETICS entrepreneur Datuk Seri Aliff Syukri has spoken about becoming a new person this Rama­dan, saying that he wants to work on strengthening ties with his family, Harian Metro reported.
Author: Tarrance Tan

Title: Retiree loses RM25,000 to Macau Scam
Summary: A 60-YEAR-OLD female retiree became RM25,000 poorer after she was duped into believing that a payment could prevent her from being arrested in Terengganu, reported Sinar Harian.
Author: N/A

Title: Cops cripple gambling syndicate raking in RM4.5mil monthly
Summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Police have crippled a gambling syndicate which was raking in about RM4.5mil every month.
Author: Austin Camoens

Title: Man who hurt wife and father-in-law found dead in Bangi home
Summary: KAJANG: Financial problems may have led a man to allegedly assault his wife and father-in law before he was found hanging from a ceiling fan at their home in Bangi.
Author: Jo Timbuong

Title: TA sees more pain for Bursa
Summary: PETALING JAYA: The stock market could potentially see more losses in the coming months due to the multiplier effect of economic consequences from the coronavirus pandemic
Author: Intan Farhana, Shazwani Binti Zainul Aberdi, Intan Farhana Zainul

Title: Teaching your kids to surf the Internet safely
Summary: Parents need to educate their children on how to behave and what to be careful of in the online world.
Author: Alexius Cheang

Title: Sabah suicide victim tests positive
Summary: KOTA KINABALU: The 12 policemen who unwittingly handled a suicide victim’s body have been put on home quarantine after it was discovered that the dead man was suffering from Covid-19.
Author: Muguntan Vanar

Title: Police inspector at MCO roadblock allegedly abducted and raped two Mongolian women
Summary: PETALING JAYA: A police officer singled out two foreign women at a movement control order (MCO) roadblock, then allegedly abducted and raped them at a hotel here.
Author: Austin Camoens

Title: We’ve been burgled
Summary: Public varsities are finally stepping up measures to tighten security on campus after incidents of students complaining that their personal belongings had been stolen.
Author: Rebecca Grace A P

Title: Sweet tooth swindle: Pastry chef cheated in love scam by 'American dentist'
Summary: SIBU: A pastry chef was cheated out of RM2,500 by a 'dentist from America' in a love scam.
Author: Andy Chua

Title: Subscriber surge for dimsum entertainment
Summary: PETALING JAYA: With the people consuming content online in the comfort of their homes, streaming service dimsum entertainment has seen a huge increase in viewership since the start of the movement control order (MCO).
Author: Qishin Tariq Lifestyletech Thestar.Com.My

Title: JKM’s new guidelines allow NGOs to distribute food to needy folk
Summary: NON-governmental organisations (NGO) can now realise their goal of helping the needy during the movement control order (MCO) with new guidelines from the Welfare Department (JKM).
Author: Grace Chen, Gracechen Thestar.Com.My

Title: Six called up over missing RM250k reported by Syed Saddiq
Summary: PETALING JAYA: Police have called in six individuals to have their statements taken over the case of missing money involving former youth and sports minister Syed Saddiq Syed Abdul Rahman.
Author: Austin Camoens
